poem:
Title: "Parallel Paradox"

Safely sprung from harm's grasp, four souls reach Albion's shore,
In halls of power, asylum's theme conflicts at the core.
Words in court echo falsely, a haunting paradox score,
Yet, the silent wards of refuge, the Home Office, open the door.
In the deceitful dance of tongues, truth's face we explore,
The heart sees clear, amid the babble, the humane chore.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. An investigation by the Observer and the campaign group Led by Donkeys reveals for the first time details of Home Office decisions on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
